website_summaries.verdict: The Under Armour Anatomix Spawn Low resembles so much and performs like the mid-top version. Wearers assert that both shoe models perform beastly. Getting the low-top or mid-top version will solely depend on preference.The traction is appreciated by many users because it gets the job done swiftly. The two versions also receive standing ovations for the comfort that their uppers and midsoles deliver. These Under Armour basketball shoes are recommended by most buyers.
pros: According to most Under Armour Anatomix Spawn Low owners, the Micro G at the midsole provides great cushioning and is quite responsive at the same time
The herringbone traction pattern reportedly grips any court floor nicely
The ventilation is so good that several buyers also use these UA shoes for running
The elevated heel of these Under Armour basketball shoes gives wearers a smooth heel-to-toe transition
The pliable toe box mesh makes it comfortable for testers to execute multidirectional footwork
Many are pleased that these Under Armour low-top basketball shoes are affordable
A large number of users agree that the Under Armour Anatomix Spawn Low is made of good quality materials
The majority of owners are pleased with the bold and bright colorways of the shoe
cons: Some users mention that the Under Armour Anatomix Spawn Low is quite heavy
Several testers claim that the grooves of the outsole rubber wear off easily
A few wearers experience pain in their arches because of the lift in the heel area
It takes over a week to break in the shoe according to a handful of buyers

customer_reviews.title: To small
customer_reviews.text: awesome shoe. The shoe is comfortable. But the size is to small.
customer_reviews.author: birowo

customer_reviews.title: Not bad!
customer_reviews.text: I’m confused by the discolored toe box of shoe 🤔but decent gym shoe....
customer_reviews.author: ck

customer_reviews.title: Looks sharp
customer_reviews.text: Looks sharp. Fit as expected, which is food for a size 15!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful Shoe
customer_reviews.text: Was not even close to fitting for me - far too tight. As much as I wanted to own/wear this shoe, it simply was too tight. With no wide options, return was all I could do. Bummed, loved the looks of the shoe
customer_reviews.author: David Sheets

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these for my son and he really likes them. He said they were very comfortable and it was like walking on air or springs. 😊
customer_reviews.author: Andrea Tobey

customer_reviews.title: Overwhelming plastic/glue smell
customer_reviews.text: These shoes stink...literally. I thought the initial plasticky/glue smell would subside over the time worn, but it has only gotten worse. These make everything in my gym bag smell like glue as well.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: They Cool But Not for Basketball
customer_reviews.text: I bought them because they were on sale and I never had a pair of Under Armour shoes before. I wear mine with jogging suits and they work out fine. If you can, I recommend going up a 1/2 size larger but wouldn't pay $100 for them.
customer_reviews.author: James Lofton

customer_reviews.title: Nice bounce but very stiff
customer_reviews.text: These are decent looking basketball shoes with a solid sole, but they are extremely stiff and don't allow for much flexibility in movement. The fit is also a bit tight even for narrow feet. Perhaps this is for better traction, but it's not particularly comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Satni

customer_reviews.title: I love under armor- worst shoes I've ever tried
customer_reviews.text: The worst most horribly feeling shoes I've ever tried on. But I wear nothing but under armor so I returned them and are happy with another model.
customer_reviews.author: Tyler

customer_reviews.title: Extra room in the toe area
customer_reviews.text: They fit a little weird what an extra room in the toe area
customer_reviews.author: Nate_b

customer_reviews.title: #Pleased with design, size, & comfort...
customer_reviews.text: Comfortable shoes. Slightly wide fit but works well for me. I use for basketball and so far, so good...
customer_reviews.author: Matt S

customer_reviews.title: Comes a 1/2 size small and laces are uncomfortable
customer_reviews.text: I returned these shoes because they seem to run a 1/2 size small. Also, for me, the laces were awkward and uncomfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Laura

customer_reviews.title: Great Shoe!
customer_reviews.text: Great shoe! This the second time I purchased them for my son. He loves them for Basketball. Came as expected with fast delivery!
customer_reviews.author: Harrio

customer_reviews.title: Nice classic style
customer_reviews.text: My son loves these shoes. Easy to wear, classic style. Looks good.
customer_reviews.author: Gail Potter

customer_reviews.title: Love these Shoes
customer_reviews.text: Great for basketball or just training. I use them more in the place of cross trainers and can go from sprints on the treadmill to dead lifting. Bottoms are firm and wont let your feet slide around.
customer_reviews.author: Isaac

customer_reviews.title: Solid purchase
customer_reviews.text: Excellent basketball shoe. Grip wears down a bit after several games playing with them but still holds up and grips the court even with some dust. Lightweight, supports ankles without restricting their mobility
customer_reviews.author: Spencer Kelly

customer_reviews.title: Great shoe.
customer_reviews.text: Great fit and excellent support; good for everyday workouts. Get this on sale don’t pay full retail since there are many competitors online with the same product For less
customer_reviews.author: Good2Go

customer_reviews.title: Looks and feels great
customer_reviews.text: Perfect combination of comfort and stability. I use them for weight training... very good forefoot stability, while not overly boosted
customer_reviews.author: Dreeemer

customer_reviews.title: Stylish shoe with great support
customer_reviews.text: Solid and stylish shoe...obviously a little stiffer than a running shoe, but also better support for non-running exercise like crossfit or weight training.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great ball shoes
customer_reviews.text: Product was great , love the color , it was on point and I very happy with my purchase
customer_reviews.author: L-Jones

customer_reviews.title: Great pair of Under Armour shoes
customer_reviews.text: These are my new favorite pair of shoes. They are comfortable and functional with good soles, and traction.
customer_reviews.author: Eric William Masker

customer_reviews.title: Showy
customer_reviews.text: The shoe is different, and I like that. Positive comments from others. Nice fit.
customer_reviews.author: Bill Massi

customer_reviews.title: Wide-foot friendly ball shoes
customer_reviews.text: Pros: traction, cushion, durable, lockdown/support Cons: lacing system is a bit unorthodox, some extra space in toe box (go down half-size if you have a regular/skinny foot)
customer_reviews.author: Kurt Espiritu

customer_reviews.title: I would buy again.
customer_reviews.text: I love the shoes and it feels great when cutting and stopping on the court.
customer_reviews.author: Brian A McBeth

customer_reviews.title: Royal blue winner
customer_reviews.text: No complaints so far so good ; ready to go court play basketball
customer_reviews.author: Fernando L Diaz

customer_reviews.title: Great Shoe
customer_reviews.text: Great shoe, runs a little large so maybe size down half a size. Great traction and good cushion. Good for wide feet as well!
customer_reviews.author: Samuel Brewington

customer_reviews.title: Bad shoe
customer_reviews.text: Stiff. No cushion. Heavy. Performance is bad. Save the extra cash and get some Kobe’s, KD’s or Jordan 34’s.
customer_reviews.author: ryan

customer_reviews.title: Dirty
customer_reviews.text: I don’t like that I got my size and they aren’t how my size fits in UA. They were dirty when received too.
customer_reviews.author: Sam

customer_reviews.title: Weird lacing
customer_reviews.text: Returned because the ankle was loose and the laces did not pull through the holes enough to tighten.
customer_reviews.author: MEG

customer_reviews.title: Super heavy
customer_reviews.text: This basketball shoe is very heavy. Not as light to move in as other basketball shoes out their.
customer_reviews.author: kevin

customer_reviews.title: Crap!!!!
customer_reviews.text: My feet started paining just 1 hour after standing. Worst shoe ever. I don’t recommend anyone to buy this shoe if you love your money.
customer_reviews.author: Dipesh Danuwar

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: A little big even when I ordered a 1/2 size smaller than usual.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Klingerman

customer_reviews.title: too big
customer_reviews.text: way too big for a sz 13. probably could fit a 14 or 14.5
customer_reviews.author: Kade Z

product_meta.title: Under Armour Men's Anatomix Spawn Low Basketball Shoes, Men's Men's Basketball Shoes
product_meta.description: After appearing on the fields around the world for the first time in 2014, the Anatomic Spawn has been updated. Its light layers conform to the foot following the body, the Micro G foam offers dynamic cushioning and the enveloping traction extends beyond the sole to provide exceptional grip. Twisted layers of TPU film and PU-coated mesh for multi-layer support in an anatomical fit Areas with visible mesh for excellent breathability and flexibility Extra padding on the tongue and around the ankle for maximum comfort Die-cut EVA midsole provides cushioning and support around the sole of the foot The Micro G foam sole transforms cushioned landings into explosive jumps The inner truss in the central part of the foot provides additional support and prevents twisting of the foot The adaptive traction pattern on the sole offers a grip that allows you to stop and restart more quickly Weight: 364 g
feature_bullets: Twisted layers of TPU film and PU-coated mesh for multi-layer support in an anatomical fit
Areas with visible mesh for excellent breathability and flexibility
Extra padding on the tongue and around the ankle for maximum comfort
Die-cut EVA midsole provides cushioning and support around the sole of the foot
The Micro G foam sole transforms cushioned landings into explosive jumps
